str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Present participle of archo; a first.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.
A primary word; 'good'.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Bad, evil, in the widest sense. Apparently a primary word; worthless, i.e. depraved, or injurious.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary word; 'good'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Commendation, praise, approval. From epi and the base of aineo; laudation; concretely, a commendable thing.
